2740/A0/05/003/004.status_value: The peer educator training indicates that there is an increase in knowledge among the peer educators following the training. It is hoped that these 50  together with the young people trained under drug prevention  which integrated HIV  will have correct knowledge of HIV and drugs.    In early 2015  through UNICEF's supported partnership  young people's knowledge and on HIV/AIDS and drug abuse was increased in five selected islands. Through this partnership  a total of 231 Young people  Adolescen
2740/A0/05/003/004.indicator_name: Percentage of adolescents (girls and boys) in selected islands with correct knowledge of HIV and drugs
2740/A0/05/003/004.baseline_value: 21.5% at national level  15-19 years in 2009 (no percentages at island level)

2740/A0/05/003/004.status_value: An HIV/Drug Abuse prevention programme was implemented in 3 islands through an NGO in 2013. Pre-test post-test evaluation of these indicates an average of 85% increase in knowledge.  Two additional trainings were conducted by National Drug Agency on the correct knowledge on harmful effects of drugs. The indicator will be revised following the MTR
2740/A0/05/003/004.indicator_name: Percentage of MARA who have the correct knowledge on harmful effects of drug abuse

2740/A0/05/003/004.status_value: An HIV/Drug Abuse prevention programme was implemented in 3 islands through an NGO in 2013. Pre-test post-test evaluation of these indicates an average of 85% increase in knowledge.  Two additional trainings were conducted by National Drug Agency on the correct knowledge on harmful effects of drugs. The indicator will be revised following the MTR
2740/A0/05/003/004.indicator_name: Percentage of MARA with correct knowledge of HIV

2740/A0/05/003/002.status_value: With UNICEF's support  Full set of IMCI package (consisting of 13 modules) were developed  finalised and printed  and is being used nationally. These serve as standards for protocols at health centers  to treat common illnesses. These resources were utilised well during the Dengue outbreak (May ¿ August 2015). Two IMCI trainings were roll-out in 2015
2740/A0/05/003/002.indicator_name: Improved health care services training modules developed

2740/A0/05/003/002.status_value: To date health service providers from ten atolls (Fuahmulah  Haa Dhaalu  Haa Alifu  Raa  Kaafu  Vaavu  Faafu  Dhaalu  Meemu - 65 islands) have been trained on IMCI localised package. Two trainings were conducted in 2015.
2740/A0/05/003/002.indicator_name: Number of selected islands of intervention with health workers trained in new-born care and Integrated management of Childhood Illnesses (IMCI)

2740/A0/05/003/002.status_value: New born care guideline development was delayed up to Dec 2013. Hence  no atolls had health workers trained on this subject by end of 2013 As a result of the MTR process  a new indicator on IMCI will be included in subsequent years
2740/A0/05/003/002.indicator_name: Number of atolls with health workers trained on new born care

2740/A0/05/003/002.status_value: The focus of trainings in 2013 has been on PMTCT and IMCI. Therefore  peri-natal mortality was not addressed.  This indicator will be removed following the MTR process.

No new data on NMR  as a DHS has not taken place since 2009. Activities to date have focused on integrated management of childhood illnesses and newborn care and well as immunization. This indicator will be removed following the MTR recommendations.

Updated data on Neonatal Mortality will be available after the DHS in 2016. Preliminary Administrative data reveals that neonatal mortality rate in 2014 was 6 per 1000 birth. UNICEF is supporting the Government to develop the New Born Care guidelines. The Child Health Strategy  is drafted with UNICEF's support in 2015 has a high focus on Essential New Born Care. Combined  the institutional building efforts will contribute to lowering of the neonatal mortality rate of Maldives

For pregnant women  87% took iron supplements during last pregnancy (DHS  2009  reported in MoH 2014 Health Profile). Programme to include pre-pregnancy women in the Iron folic supplementation is under discussion. UNICEF and UNFPA is advocating for it.
2740/A0/05/003/002.indicator_name: Percentage of pre-pregnant & pregnant women receiving Iron supplementation (60 mg iron   400 µg folic acid daily) for six months
2740/A0/05/003/002.baseline_value: 0 (Proxy indicator pregnant women receiving iron tablets for 3 months = 87%)

2740/A0/05/003/003.status_value: A hygiene education programme is being developed for schools and a training for curriculum developers and teachers is being developed. Pretesting of the hygiene education materials will be completed in 5 schools by end of 2015 and the roll out of the programme to schools will commence in the 1st term of 2016.
2740/A0/05/003/003.indicator_name: No. of schools with hygiene education programmes by 2015

2740/A0/05/003/003.status_value: IEC materials on puberty and menstrual hygiene management are being developed in consultation with schools health workers  teachers and adolescent girls and boys and pretested. That includes 1 poster  2 factsheets  and 2 videos
2740/A0/05/003/003.indicator_name: No of gender sensitive WASH-in-Schools guides/toolkits/ IEC materials developed

2740/A0/05/003/003.status_value: No activities against this indicator in 2013. The indicator will be removed after the Mid-term review.
2740/A0/05/003/003.indicator_name: Percentage of households treating their drinking water to make it safe (boil  filter or chlorinate)

2740/A0/05/003/003.status_value: Activities focused on hand washing and hygiene in 22 schools in 2013.  According to findings from WASH in school assessment  98% of the schools have hand-washing facilities inside the toilet area  and only 4% have designated hand-washing outside the toilet area. After the MTR  a new indicator on Hygiene Promotion under WinS will be added.
2740/A0/05/003/003.indicator_name: Percentage of schools with designated hand-washing facility

2740/A0/05/003/003.status_value: No activities against this indicator in 2013.  The indicator will be removed following the Mid-term review recommendations.
2740/A0/05/003/003.indicator_name: Percentage of households with designated hand-washing facility

2740/A0/05/003/003.status_value: The activity on hand washing and hygiene in 22 schools (aprox 7%) conducted in 2012 -2013 also targeted the parents. It lacked information on other hygiene related areas.  The indicator will be removed following the Mid-term review recommendations.
2740/A0/05/003/003.indicator_name: Percentage of community members with adequate knowledge on good hygiene

2740/A0/05/003/003.status_value: No activities against this indicator in 2013.  The indicator will be removed following the Mid-term review recommendations.
2740/A0/05/003/003.indicator_name: Percentage of population practicing improved sanitation behaviour

2740/A0/05/003/001.status_value: Revised after the MTR 2013 to a new one as indicated.
This indicator was moved to a outcome level indicator as of MTR 2013.
This indicator was moved to a outcome level indicator as of MTR 2013.
2740/A0/05/003/001.indicator_name: Percentage of children less than 6 months who are exclusively breastfed

2740/A0/05/003/001.status_value: Revised after the MTR 2013 to a new one as indicated.

UNICEF has supported nutrition interventions in the selected islands that will contribute to stunting reduction in the pilot islands. A Maternal and child nutrition BCC campaign has been launched and will be rolled out. The BCC messages is designed to target behavior change that contribute to stunting and wasting. Updated data on stunting prevalence will be available after DHS 2015/2016.
2740/A0/05/003/001.indicator_name: Percentage of children aged 0¿59 months who are stunted in the piloted islands
2740/A0/05/003/001.baseline_value: 22.7 (North Central region data used as proxy)

2740/A0/05/003/001.status_value: The latest DHS data is 60% (2009)  Updated data be available after DHS 2015/2016. With partnership with an NGO (ARC) demonstration activities was carried in high prevalence islands. At the systems development level  With UNICEF's support  IYCF Master Trainers training was completed  and IYCF standards have been developed.
2740/A0/05/003/001.indicator_name: Percentage of children 6-24 months receiving appropriate complementary feeding (as defined by the set criteria of Frequency  Amount  Density (energy)  Use of variety food and Active feeding) in piloted islands
2740/A0/05/003/001.baseline_value: 60 (North Central region data used as proxy)

2740/A0/05/003/001.status_value: The set target of 6 islands have been surpassed in 2014.  Additional trainings in 2015 focused on sustaining and strengthening the institutional capacity. As such  breastfeeding counselling and IYCF Master Trainings took place in 2015  covering 6 regions (serving aprox 150 islands out of 189)  around 6000 child under two). Key intervention also targeted the high prevalence islands in 3rd Quarter 2015
2740/A0/05/003/001.indicator_name: Number of selected islands with health workers trained on comprehensive child nutrition

2740/A0/05/002/003.status_value: One child deprivation equity profile developed
2740/A0/05/002/003.indicator_name: Number of analytical papers on disparities and other social issues relevant to children developed and disseminated

Revised after the MTR 2013 to a new one as indicated.
Social Sector budget analysis ongoing ¿ Economic analysis completed.
Revised after the MTR 2013 to a new one as indicated.
2740/A0/05/002/003.indicator_name: KAP studies on: hygiene & sanitation  sustainable environmental practices among children  revised curriculum framework  drug abuse

2740/A0/05/004/003.status_value: 18% of schools in the country offered life skills education by end of 2014.

Number of girls and boys with knowledge on life skills and environmental education

2740/A0/05/004/003.status_value: By end of 2015 10 schools in ten islands have functional environmental clubs.
2740/A0/05/004/003.indicator_name: Number of schools in selected islands with functional environmental clubs

2740/A0/05/004/003.status_value: Five new schools started LSE in 2013. To date 50 schools (24%) have offered LSE to their students. Going forward  focus will be on monitoring and institutionalization of LSE. The indicator / target will be revised following the MTR process
2740/A0/05/004/003.indicator_name: Percentage of schools offering life skills education programmes

2740/A0/05/004/003.status_value: Due to lack of partners  no activity on imparting sustainable environmental knowledge and practices to children were conducted in 2013.  The indicator / target will be revised following the MTR process
2740/A0/05/004/003.indicator_name: Percentage of school children with appropriate knowledge on sustainable environmental practices

2740/A0/05/004/003.status_value: Due to lack of partners  no activity was conducted in 2013.  The indicator / target will be revised following the MTR process
2740/A0/05/004/003.indicator_name: Percentage schools with active environmental clubs

2740/A0/05/002/001.baseline_value: Pilot project initiated in one island

2740/A0/05/002/001.status_value: M&E training were not carried out during the year due to the abolishment of the government partner agency: Department of National Planning under the Ministry of Finance and Treasury. The mandate was transferred to the Ministry of Housing and Infrastructure (Office of Project and Programme ¿ OPP) and a partnership was established to carry forward the agenda but did not materialize due to abolishment of OPP. A new section of Policy Planning Section under the Ministry of Finance and Treasury has si
2740/A0/05/002/001.indicator_name: Number of sectors with M&E plans

2740/A0/05/002/001.status_value: M&E course was changes to Social Policy Course  which was established at Maldives National University and 5 students are continuing the Masters course. An assessment carried out to find out the reasons and some changes have been brought in terms of delivery and entrance criteria.
2740/A0/05/002/001.indicator_name: M&E course established at the Feculty of Management and computing

2740/A0/05/002/001.status_value: Shifted to 2016  following eventual placement of defunct planning functions in the Ministry of Finance and Treasury
2740/A0/05/002/001.indicator_name: Number of M&E personnel trained at national and sub-national levels

2740/A0/05/002/001.status_value: Masters course is continuing with the 18 student with 4 students from the first batch graduating.
2740/A0/05/002/001.indicator_name: ¿	M&E Training module developed as part of Civil Servants capacity building

2740/A0/06/882/003.status_value: With the draft CERT framework (including training regime) currently in place  the NDMC has planned a nation-wide consultation on establishing CERTs with island councils representatives from all islands in the 3rd week of August.   Following the consultations  the first CERT will be piloted in Laamu atoll in the 1st week of September  followed by the establishment of the teams in 3 more islands of the atoll as planned.
2740/A0/06/882/003.indicator_name: Community Emergency Response Team (CERT) framework developed and operational
2740/A0/06/882/003.headline: Child and gender-sensitive disaster risk reduction strengthened through development of Vulnerability and Capacity Assessments and Disaster Risk Reduction plans.  11 islands community increased their capacity to prepare and respond to climate hazards. conceptual framework needed to establish island-community response teams developed.

2740/A0/06/882/003.status_value: As requested by NDMC  the establishment of Community Emergency Response Teams (CERTs) as a key component of the NERF would be supported by UNICEF MCO instead. Conceptual framework needed to establish the CERTs is currently being developed with UNICEF's technical assistance.

2740/A0/05/004/002.status_value: Systemic work has been done to pave the way for the new foundation stage curriculum implementation for 2015. These include the curricula  curriculum guides  learning materials and training of preschool teachers. Starting 2015  the foundation stage curriculum has been rolled out nation-wide.   The curriculum guides for the foundation stage have been finalised and printed. TOT trainings and several batches of training have been conducted.   All schools have been implementing the foundation stage c
2740/A0/05/004/002.indicator_name: Number of schools in which foundation stage curriculum is applied

2740/A0/05/004/002.indicator_name: Number of research reports on special needs teacher education

2740/A0/05/004/002.status_value: Support on preschool teacher training has not taken place. Ground work has been initiated  Support to Preschool Act is complete  and support to strengthen preschool curriculum roll-out through technical backstopping is ongoing

Around 10% of schools (30 schools) estimated to have SEN trained teachers (Dec 2013 estimate). The first batch of Diploma students graduated in year 2012 has begun working in schools. 19 graduates completed the Diploma in Special Needs Education  and most are working in different schools across Maldives
2740/A0/05/004/002.indicator_name: Percentage of schools with a trained SEN teacher

2740/A0/06/881/003.status_value: Features and indicators to track children with disabilities in school are integrated in to the EMIS Core module. Additionally  the medical history of the child and information on additional support  required for the care of the child can be now obtained

Children in conflict with the law who are out of schools are reached with alternative and skills development programs and life skills

2740/A0/06/881/003.status_value: OOSC module is developed and integrated in the Education Management Information System (EMIS). In its current stage  the system can capture and track data on students attendance  and behavior. An early warning system to identify children at risk of dropping out is also embedded in the module.
2740/A0/06/881/003.indicator_name: "e2a. EMIS that provides quality and timely data - score (1-4)  see guidance"

These are meant to generate data  tracking learning achievements and further informing policy decisions.

2740/A0/06/881/002.status_value: CHS and Action plan finalised and endorsed. Costing postponed to 2017 as there needs to be an operational plan developed first  to apply the costing tool
2740/A0/06/881/002.indicator_name: "Costed implementation plan for maternal  newborn and child health care available"
2740/A0/06/881/002.headline: Operational plan for Child Health Strategy is developed and data configuration for the Online Health Tool is completed. Measles Elimination campaign was conducted  and Maldives is now Measles free. UNICEF supported the health sector response H1NI outbreak. Capacity was built on essential newborn care and advanced Life support training.
2740/A0/06/881/002.target_value: CHS developed and endorsed  and costed plan developed

2740/A0/06/881/002.status_value: With the need to build capacity on Neonatal care and treatment   70 health care providers were trained  on Essential Newborn Care (from Shaviyani  Laam and Addu Atolls / Districts).  In addition  Advanced Life Support Training of 14 Doctors in Tertiary Hospitals took place in June  and one Pediatrician has been certified as Advanced Life Support Training of Trainer as an international level
2740/A0/06/881/002.indicator_name: Community Health Workers trained to implement integrated community case management (% of actually trained against the planned)

Measles Elimination campaign was conducted  and Maldives is now Measles free. UNICEF supported the health sector response H1NI outbreak. Capacity was built on essential newborn care and advanced Life support training.

2740/A0/06/881/001.status_value: Intial discussions with partners initiated  though the BCC strategy development process is  delayed. Partnership with NGO  explored  but was not feasible. Discussed and reviewed in the Mid-year review  considered timeline and feasibility of having a finalised BCC plan was uncertain. Still  it was agreed to pursue and continue into next year. Conceptualization and scoping process ongoing  and consensus reached with stakeholders to focus the BCC on the first 1000 days.

2740/A0/06/881/001.headline: Growth Monitoring Standards with ECD was developed. Parents benefited from Breast feeding and IYCF education  helping to make informed choices on nutritious food. Maldives participated in the SAARC¿UNICEF regional nutrition conference on wasting - a critical advocacy platform to increase the political commitment to improve maternal and child nutrition.

2740/A0/06/881/006.status_value: CSGs in 14 islands established in three atolls
2740/A0/06/881/006.indicator_name: "Municipalities that implement local protocols for the protection of children from violence  abuse and neglect "
2740/A0/06/881/006.headline: System strengthened for timely and coordinated response to VAC through established multi Xsectoral technical working groups linked to CSGs  promoting a coordinated approach to VAC. Additionally  Child Protection Database  enhanced to web-based application  has allowed more (7) institutions to feed in data  providing rich disaggregated-data for informed prevention/response measures.

2740/A0/06/881/006.status_value: Discussion on generating reports and publication of reports inititiated
2740/A0/06/881/006.indicator_name: "(DEACTIVATED Jan 1 2017) Existence of routine administrative data  collection systems  and publications on violence  exploitation and abuse of children including violent deaths and injuries"
2740/A0/06/881/006.headline: System strengthened for timely and coordinated response to VAC through established multi Xsectoral technical working groups linked to CSGs  promoting a coordinated approach to VAC. Additionally  Child Protection Database  enhanced to web-based application  has allowed more (7) institutions to feed in data  providing rich disaggregated-data for informed prevention/response measures.
2740/A0/06/881/006.baseline_value: Maldives Child Protection Database available  limited use

2740/A0/06/881/006.status_value: The Ahan mobile application launched for easy access to reporting on VAC cases from the remote islands. Call center launched linked to MCPD database
2740/A0/06/881/006.indicator_name: "Sex and age disaggregated data on violence  exploitation and abuse of children are routinely collected  analyzed and published and used to inform national planning processes "
2740/A0/06/881/006.headline: System strengthened for timely and coordinated response to VAC through established multi Xsectoral technical working groups linked to CSGs  promoting a coordinated approach to VAC. Additionally  Child Protection Database  enhanced to web-based application  has allowed more (7) institutions to feed in data  providing rich disaggregated-data for informed prevention/response measures.
2740/A0/06/881/006.target_value: data routinely collected  analyzed and used in decision making

2740/A0/06/881/006.status_value: A technical working group from key stakeholders was established by the Minister of Gender and Family at national level for coordination and multi-sectoral solutions for child related issues at island level. Further  multi-sectoral community Social Groups in selected atolls with high incidences of cases of violence against children have been established to provide a holistic approach to VAC
2740/A0/06/881/006.indicator_name: (DEACTIVATED Jan 1 2017) Child Protection system has both preventive and responsive services available that are fully aligned and complementary
2740/A0/06/881/006.headline: System strengthened for timely and coordinated response to VAC through established multi Xsectoral technical working groups linked to CSGs  promoting a coordinated approach to VAC. Additionally  Child Protection Database  enhanced to web-based application  has allowed more (7) institutions to feed in data  providing rich disaggregated-data for informed prevention/response measures.
2740/A0/06/881/006.baseline_value: Limited services for prevention and response available

2740/A0/06/881/006.status_value: 28 Social Workers participated in refresher training on risk assessments  report writing  development of intervention plans  and techniques for interviewing children and adults. Additionally  Social Workers were oriented on the emerging issue of on-line sexual exploitation and sex tourism  orientation screening of persons with sexual abuse reports during visa approval processes  together with Police and Immigration Officers
2740/A0/06/881/006.indicator_name: Number of social service workers in the country
2740/A0/06/881/006.headline: System strengthened for timely and coordinated response to VAC through established multi Xsectoral technical working groups linked to CSGs  promoting a coordinated approach to VAC. Additionally  Child Protection Database  enhanced to web-based application  has allowed more (7) institutions to feed in data  providing rich disaggregated-data for informed prevention/response measures.

2740/A0/06/881/005.indicator_name: "Municipalities that implement local protocols for the protection of children from violence  abuse and neglect "
2740/A0/06/881/005.headline: Community Social Groups (CSG)  a community-level first-line response mechanism for VAC  were established in islands for early identification of children at-risk and timely responses in liaison with social-workers at National-level. A community-based juvenile crime prevention and diversion programme was established with an aim of reintegration back into society

2740/A0/06/881/005.status_value: 28 existing SW received in service training. work on developing On-line training programme initiated
2740/A0/06/881/005.indicator_name: Number of social service workers in the country

A community-based juvenile crime prevention and diversion programme was established with an aim of reintegration back into society

2740/A0/06/881/005.status_value: Case management practices reviewed  Procedure Manual Revised  for strengthening Supervison of Case Workers in progress  further  33 Investigating Officers from Maldives Police Service have been trained on Advanced Child Interviewing Techniques Course (ACIT). As of now  60 cases of child abuse have been investigated and ready for prosecution.
2740/A0/06/881/005.indicator_name: (DEACTIVATED Jan 1 2017) Child Protection system has both preventive and responsive services available that are fully aligned and complementary

A community-based juvenile crime prevention and diversion programme was established with an aim of reintegration back into society
2740/A0/06/881/005.target_value: system functional with preventive abd responsive services

2740/A0/06/881/005.status_value: Procedure Manual for case management revised
2740/A0/06/881/005.indicator_name: Institutional mechanisms for prevention and resposive services in place

A community-based juvenile crime prevention and diversion programme was established with an aim of reintegration back into society

2740/A0/06/881/004.status_value: ALP Policy frame work is drafted and pending finalization by MOE
2740/A0/06/881/004.indicator_name: "e5d. Existence of a school re-entry policy/strategy for pregnant girls and/or adolescent mothers - score (1-4)  see guidance"
2740/A0/06/881/004.headline: Alternative education programmes and skills development programs for children and adolescents who are at the risk of dropping out of school  and /or are out of school are being provided through existing mechanisms in the country.
2740/A0/06/881/004.target_value: 10% of out of school children enrolled in the programs

2740/A0/05/006/002.status_value: 21 schools in Male' and 3 selected islands currently have functioning Child Rights Clubs 5 schools in Male' have functioning Media Clubs
2740/A0/05/006/002.indicator_name: Number of schools with functional school clubs (inclusive of girls and boys) within Male' and selected islands

2740/A0/05/006/002.status_value: 3 adolescent /youth camps  a quiz competition  child rights clinics in Male' and selected islands were conducted as advocacy forums to promote child rights and child participation throughout the year
2740/A0/05/006/002.indicator_name: Number of advocacy events by schools to promote child participation

2740/A0/05/006/002.status_value: The strategy to achieve the result  with the intention to institutionalize it  was to initially train the Human Rights Commission of Maldives. However  the planned activity has not taken place due to lack of technical capacity at country level.
2740/A0/05/006/002.indicator_name: Number of Civil Society Groups trained on child rights

2740/A0/05/006/002.status_value: Activities contributing to this result have been postponed for 2014 due to several bottlenecks such as limited availability of the few CSOs working in the area of child rights to give time for trainings as well as due to lack of technical capacity at HRCM level to support the trainings
2740/A0/05/006/002.indicator_name: . Percentage of civil society partners actively engaged in monitoring compliance with CRC

2740/A0/05/006/001.status_value: Over 150 journalists trained throughout the period 2013-2015 from both freelance and established media agencies on ethical reporting and CRC
2740/A0/05/006/001.indicator_name: Number of media agencies engaged in child rights reporting

2740/A0/05/006/001.status_value: The Core Media Pool held over 6 major advocacy initiatives during the year. The activities had targeted civil society groups  women's groups  schools  children  youth  adolescents  parents and media agencies
2740/A0/05/006/001.indicator_name: No. of advocacy activities initiated by the media on promoting child rights by 2015

2740/A0/05/006/001.status_value: 35 media personnel trained on CRC and ethical reporting on children in the media in three regions  Male'  H.Dhaa and G. Dhaal Atolls
Monitoring tool to assess the quality and coverage of children's issues in print and broadcast media being developed and will be completed for use within the first quarter of 2014
2740/A0/05/006/001.indicator_name: Percentage of media reports on child related that meet UNICEF minimum standards for reporting on children

2740/A0/06/880/004.indicator_name: Number of new partnerships with NGOs and Private Sector developed

2740/A0/06/880/005.indicator_name: Number of child-centred cross sectoral events

2740/A0/05/005/001.status_value: Refresher training for existing Social Workers from FCSCs and MoLG delivered.  Discussions initiated to strengthen FHS for delivery of social work training programme
2740/A0/05/005/001.indicator_name: Percentage of Social Workers working in FCSCs and MoHG with a minimum training to appropriately respond to child abuse and gender-based violence

2740/A0/05/005/001.status_value: No direct progress towards the results. However  capacity building of individual sectors on-going
2740/A0/05/005/001.indicator_name: Number of functioning rapid response teams at selected FCSCs and Male'

2740/A0/05/005/001.status_value: 15 islands from 5 atolls reached with awareness programmes on child abuse prevention as part of the on-going child abuse prevention campaign.  Creation of the ¿Community Social Groups¿ under the initiative of the MoLG for ¿Social Services delivered at Community Doorsteps¿ will also contribute towards establishing a model for community based prevention and responding to violence against children
2740/A0/05/005/001.indicator_name: Number of selected islands of intervention with on-going community-based child abuse prevention activities targeting boys and girls

2740/A0/05/005/001.status_value: The frequent changes to the leadership in the line ministry was recognized as the main bottleneck hindering progress towards the achievement of the planned result. Although coordination between some sectors has improved  it is still seen as a bottleneck.   Capacity gap analysis and training needs assessment for strengthening Social Service Workers  one of the main activities contributing to achievement of this result had to be postponed to 2014. However  UNICEF's contribution resulted in trainin
2740/A0/05/005/001.indicator_name: Number of functioning rapid response teams

2740/A0/05/005/001.status_value: Although a number of activities have been initiated no activities were completed in 2013 that contribute towards the achievement of planned results.   Slow decision making at the line ministry and non availability of the targeted groups due to the political situation and the delayed presidential election had been the biggest bottleneck.   Lack of civil society groups poses a challenge towards achieving the result. There is a strong need for new strategy for achieving the planned result.   The sc
2740/A0/05/005/001.indicator_name: Number of functioning community-based child abuse prevention programmes

2740/A0/05/005/001.status_value: Funds secured for the baseline study. To be conducted in beginning of 2016.
2740/A0/05/005/001.indicator_name: Proportion of women married by age of 18 years

2740/A0/05/005/002.status_value: Juvenile Crime Prevention activities implemented in two selected islands. The outcome of the Multi sectoral consultation  based on the lessons learned from the 2 pilot programmes  contributed to finalizing the package of interventions for Community based Juvenile Crime Prevention Programmes for boys and girls..
2740/A0/05/005/002.indicator_name: Number of selected islands of intervention with community based crime prevention program targeting boys and girls

2740/A0/05/005/002.status_value: Pilot testing of Diversion programme for Children in Conflict with Law initiated in one of the atolls.
2740/A0/05/005/002.indicator_name: Community reintegration programme for boys and girls established at JJU

2740/A0/05/005/002.status_value: Activities contributing towards the results are on track. Active participation and commitment from the main partners are factors contributing to the successful implementation of planned activities.   The main bottleneck hindering is the lack of legislation pertaining to juvenile justice. High level advocacy strategy is required to press for expediting the process.  This indicator will be revised based on the MTR recommendation.
2740/A0/05/005/002.indicator_name: Percentage of children served through the juvenile justice system

2740/A0/05/005/002.status_value: Components contributing towards achievement of this result have been initiated.   Lack of juvenile justice legislations and guidelines is the main bottleneck to achieving the result. In addition lack of civil society groups working in this area may pose a challenge.
2740/A0/05/005/002.indicator_name: Percentage of children reintegrated in community
